trend_summary: 2000-2022 imagery shows modest urban creep from the coastal city into adjacent farmland, while most of the territory remains agricultural and wooded. Built-up footprint rises slowly, road network densifies, villages enlarge, yet forest cover on western hills recovers slightly. Overall density stays sparse and the landscape remains predominantly rural.
notable_changes: Gradual northward and eastward expansion of the southern coastal city into surrounding fields.
New industrial/commercial estate appears near the main highway junction.
Scattered housing clusters infill along the river corridor, linking small villages.
Road network and bypass construction increase regional connectivity.
Western hillside shows patches of regrowth/afforestation replacing former clearings.
